content:
No, it is not common for astronauts to have pets with them on the International Space Station. While pets can provide companionship and emotional support, the close quarters and unique environment of the space station make it difficult for animals to adapt and live safely.

In addition, bringing animals to the space station would require a significant amount of additional resources and logistical planning, including specialized habitats, food, and waste disposal systems.

While it is true that the space station can be a lonely environment, astronauts utilize a variety of other strategies to maintain their emotional and mental wellbeing, including regular communication with family and friends on Earth, exercise, and support from their crewmates.
